page.title: 10Roads
page.content: The main road from Swansea to Brecon (A4067)winds along the floor of the Swansea Valley. At Ystalyfera a new road was made in the 1960's to by-pass the village of Godre-Graig,when the old road was partly destroyed in a landslide. The road from Cwmllynfell down to Cwmtwrch is a twisting road mainly following the course of the river Twrch (B4599) A road to by-pass the town of Ystradgynlais was built in the 1970's on the route of the old Swansea canal. This main road now passes through the village of Gurnos.
